summary: This document is an email chain from November 2019 regarding Nicholas Tartaglione, a former cellmate of Jeffrey Epstein. Defense attorney Bruce Barket offers Tartaglione's information to rebut the murder theory and support the conclusion that Epstein was suicidal, referencing both the July 2019 suicide attempt and the August 2019 suicide. The email is addressed to an Assistant U.S. Attorney.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney at Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP who sent an email offering his client Nicholas Tartaglione's information regarding Jeffrey Epstein's state of mind and jail conditions.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Former cellmate of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center who has information about Epstein's suicide attempt in July 2019 and the facility conditions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The financier and accused sex trafficker who was Tartaglione's cellmate and who died by suicide in August 2019 after a prior attempt in July 2019.

persons.name: Donna Aldea
persons.context: Attorney from the same law firm as Bruce Barket who is referenced as having written a prior communication about Tartaglione.

connections.description: Tartaglione was a cellmate with Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center until Epstein's suicide attempt in July 2019.
Bruce Barket's law firm represents Nicholas Tartaglione, as stated in his email offering Tartaglione's information.
Both are attorneys at the same law firm, Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's first suicide attempt while incarcerated, during which he was cellmates with Nicholas Tartaglione.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Attorney Offer of Information
events.description: Bruce Barket emails an Assistant U.S. Attorney offering his client Nicholas Tartaglione's information to rebut murder theories and support the suicide conclusion regarding Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (implied as the facility where Epstein and Tartaglione were held)
Garden City, NY 11530 (location of Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP)
keyFacts: Nicholas Tartaglione, a former cellmate of Jeffrey Epstein, possesses information that supports the conclusion Epstein was suicidal and rebuts murder theories.
Tartaglione's information covers both Epstein's July 2019 suicide attempt and the August 2019 suicide, as well as facility conditions and staff conduct.
Defense attorney Bruce Barket offered this information to an Assistant U.S. Attorney in November 2019, suggesting a meeting to discuss.
The email chain indicates prior communication from attorney Donna Aldea on the same subject regarding Tartaglione and Epstein.
